author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sabesan Shanmugasundaram, Director of a Chennai-based company, Green Bay Agro Private Limited, was found dead at his farm at Kaakudi village under Mandalamanickam police limits in Kamudhi taluk.

Police suspect that Sabesan, one of the two directors of the company, must have died in the farm house on the night of Thursday with his two dogs.

The deaths came to light on Friday morning. His associate K. Raju (45), who was fighting for life, had been admitted to a private hospital in Madurai.

The police, which registered a case under Section 174 (3) (iv) of Cr PC (suspicious death) suspect that Sabesan and the dogs could have died due to poisoning. It was not clear whether it was a case of suicide or murder, police said.

A team of police led by the Deputy Superintendent of Police has launched an investigation. Preliminary post-mortem reports suggest that the victims could have died of poisoning but police are awaiting the full report.

Sabesan, who hails from Adampakkam in Chennai, was running the 600 acre farm with Manokaran Naleni, his co-director. They were carrying out agriculture and animal husbandry activities in the farm, police said.

Ms. Naleni, wife of Manoharan, lodged a complaint with the police. Mr. Raju, who is undergoing treatment, hails from Pambulnayakkanpatti.
title: Businessman found dead in Ramnad district
